page.title: 05Kirtlington Church
page.content: The Saxons built a Church out of wood on the site of the present Church in about 700 A.D. for followers of the Christian religion. The wooden church was destroyed and a stone church was built in about 977 A.D.. The Normans built the present church on the same site in the 12th century. In 1716 the Lady Chapel became the Dashwood family chapel. The Lady Chapel was built in the 13th century. There is a wall painting of St.George and the Dragon which was painted in the 15th century. There is an 18th century sundial on the south side of the church. The church can hold 250 people if they are sitting down. Rev D. Wilcox is the Rector of the United Benefice of Kirtlington, Bletchington, Weston-on-the-Green and Hampton Gay.
